results.title: The Chain of life
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Vanishing Wilderness”.
Man is destroying his environment when he uses chemical instead of biological pesticide controls. Man is the end link in the chain of life and is limiting his own survival when he destroys other links in that chain.

results.title: Slow death of desert water
results.creator_credit: Shelly Grossman and National Educational Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Vanishing Wilderness”.
Shows what is happening to Pyramid Lake, in Nevada, and its wild life because dams divert its source of water and sonic booms frighten its wild life. Based on the book “Our vanishing wilderness” by Mary Louise and Shelly Grossman and John Hamlet, 1969.
results.description:

results.title: Santa Barbara: everybody's mistake
results.creator_credit: Shelly Grossman and National Educational Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Vanishing Wilderness”.
Examines the controversies behind the 2 million gallon oil leak in the Santa Barbara Channel, off the coast of California in 1969. Shows how smog created by oil is killing pine trees high above sea level. The film asks why a society places such a high value on oil that it willingly endangers its own life. Based on the book “Our Vanishing Wilderness” by Mary Louise and Shelly Grossman and John Hamlet.
results.description:

results.title: Sadek: speaking English
results.creator_credit: Michael Robertson, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
A biographical account of an Egyptian migrant, Sadek. The film discusses the adult education classes he attends, and the problems he has to face with his limited knowledge of English Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Teja: a Sikh priest
results.creator_credit: Michael Rubetzki, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”
Describes the Indian Sikh community in Woolgoolga, in New South Wales, and Teja Singh, the community priest. Explores his role in the preservation of the culture, traditions and religion of the old life in India, and his view of the necessary changes and adaptations that the future will bring.

results.title: Murawina: self help
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Jan Sharp, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Murawina is a First Nations pre-school in Chippendale, an inner suburb of Sydney. The mothers who run Murawina want a separate pre-school for their children, because they want to develop in their children a black pride that may not be encouraged by the white schools the children will next go to. The film raises questions about prejudice, the influence of past experiences on present day attitudes and the relationship between urban and tribal First Nations peoples.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Roberts, Jan Sharp, Tom Manefield and Film Australia

results.title: Mick: revisited
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Second part of a longitudinal study of Mick, an adolescent from Sydney’s western suburbs. Looks at the effects that the first film, made two years earlier, had on him and explores his attitudes towards his ethnic background. (See the first part “Mick” (Title code 012708).

results.title: Margaret: a pride in identity
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Margaret is an urban aboriginal woman who became involved in the pre-school Murawina, first as a mother then later as a trainee pre-school teacher. Margaret is shown at home with her white Australian husband and at work. The film stresses the importance of Aboriginal identity.

results.title: Maria going home
results.creator_credit: Debby Kingsland, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Maria, originally from Spain, has been in Australia some fifteen years - half her life. In the film she and her family discuss plans to return to Spain. The film is intended to show why a family, materially and professionally successful in Australia and with two Australian born children might choose to uproot themselves a second time.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Debby Kingsland, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
